member.name: DXCoreAdapterState
member.summary: Defines constants that specify kinds of DXCore adapter states. Pass one of these constants to the IDXCoreAdapter.QueryState method to retrieve the adapter state item for a state kind; pass a constant to the IDXCoreAdapter.SetState method to set an adapter's info for a state item.

summary.para: Specifies the IsDriverUpdateInProgress adapter state, which when true indicates that a driver update has been initiated on the adapter but it has not yet completed. If the driver update has already completed, then the adapter will have been invalidated, and your QueryState call will return a HRESULT of DXGI_ERROR_DEVICE_REMOVED.
When calling QueryState, the IsDriverUpdateInProgress state item has type uint8_t, representing a Boolean value.
Important. This state item is not supported for SetState.
Specifies the AdapterMemoryBudget adapter state, which retrieves or requests the adapter memory budget on the adapter.
When calling QueryState, the AdapterMemoryBudget adapter state has type for inputStateDetails, and type for outputBuffer.
Important. This state item is not supported for SetState.

Specifies the AdapterMemoryReservation adapter state, which represents the minimum required physical memory to set, in bytes, on the adapter. We recommend that you set an adapter reservation in order to denote the amount of physical memory that your application can't go without. This value helps the operating system (OS) to quickly minimize the impact of large memory-pressure situations.
When calling SetState, the AdapterMemoryReservation adapter state has type for inputStateDetails, and type uint64_t for inputData.
Important. This state item is not supported for QueryState.
